Articles.Content: Hey, I have a heavily modded install of KSP, running 1.3 with all updated mods (except for a few, but I have patches and whatnot), and there is this odd, shiny white pill like object that is everywhere. It is in the VAB and the SPH where the parent part is and follows me in flight, even in EVA. I have looked everywhere for a solution and I found one. There was an old thread from 2014 and it said that it was an incorrectly packaged .dll file called 'CITUtil.dll' that is apart of the ActiveStruts mod for IR, but I don't have that file. It also said that it had something to do with Unity and it was a bug or something for that? I have looked all over my PC and couldn't find a file named CITUtil.dll. I have put up with this bug for too long and I'd like to have a solution to it, thanks.

KSP.log?

Upload KSP.log to a filesharing site such as Dropbox ... DO NOT COPY/PASTE HERE as the file is too long and searching through it on the forum is a laborious task which most wont even bother to look at if provided in this fashion

You can find the file in your KSP directory ... KSP.log is overwritten each time you start KSP so be sure that the log comes from a game where you experienced this issue

The link is locked ... I need permission to download the file

Do you have Planet shine I did not have a problem with it until the last update from Kerbal  1.3  the last patch they sent out.

I was getting bars and balls even in the assembly base I removed it for now. you link is also locked. Have you tried removing all your mods into a desktop folder than add them one by one until the caltrop shows up. make sure you also check it out when no mods are loaded. sometimes this is a lot easier than trying to track down a corrupt file. or one that doesn't play well with others.

11 hours ago, DoctorDavinci said:

Sure, sorry I don't use this much, give me 1 sec...

It looks like the unity player asset or something from the whack-a-kerbal, and a number of mods that I have installed it would take forever, so I just wanted to see if someone knew what was going on with the game. I know it is some mod that probably wasn't installed correctly. I have a non-CKAN install if anyone was asking. But all aside, I do have planetshine installed, but I had this issue way before I started adding visual mods to my game.

I'm not saying this is the problem but I would try this first . can you send a screen shot of what you are seeing. Just trying to help I will let my son know he fixes all the problems I can not fix. but also lets me know there are some things with mods that just can not be fixed

So, I solved it I guess? I uninstalled Infernal robotics and that made it disappear, but I'd like to know what is actually a wrong with the mod because I find Infernal Robotics to be quite an essential mod for ksp. So if anyone knows what exactly is wrong with this, I'd love to know, thanks.
